thread.title: College Corner: One more goal for Nikki Elsaesser
thread.title_full: College Corner: One more goal for Nikki Elsaesser

title: College Corner: One more goal for Nikki Elsaesser
text:
College Corner: One more goal for Nikki Elsaesser Jerry Carino , @njhoopshaven 7:16 p.m. EDT October 12, 2015 The Timothy Christian grad looks to lead Messiah to a D-3 title in women's soccer. Nikki Elsaesser (in white) has been a star at Messiah. (Photo: Messiah College Athletics) CONNECT 14 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
The phrases “good fortune” and “torn ACL” don’t appear in the same sentence very often, but Nikki Elsaesser looks back on her knee injury as fortuitous. 
It may have been why the Timothy Christian School grad ended up at Messiah College, where she is putting the finishing touches on a spectacular soccer career. 
“It’s the most special team, the chemistry and everything,” Elsaesser said. 
The injury occurred during her junior year of high school, while she was playing basketball. 
“I missed a lot of showcase (soccer) tournaments, and I thought I might be done for college,” said Elsaesser, who hails from Old Bridge. “My coach now (Scott Frey) had seen me play before, so he was still willing to take me. I look at the injury as a blessing from God. If I hadn’t gotten hurt, I don’t’ know where I would have ended up.” 
Located in Mechanicsburg, Pa., Messiah is a longtime Division III powerhouse. As a freshman in 2012, Elsaesser started some games and helped the Falcons win the NCAA Division III title for the second straight year. 
“I owe my transition to the senior class that year,” she said. “They made you feel so welcomed and didn’t make you feel like a little freshman who couldn’t do anything.” College Corner: P-Way's Williams aiding soccer power 
She has returned the favor to subsequent newcomers. The result speaks for itself. 
“We end up winning a lot of games but people don’t see the behind-the-scenes part of that,” Elsaesser said, “how we invest in each other as teammates more than as individuals. If matters more that we’re friends.” 
On the field, Elsaesser is working her way up Messiah’s record book. She currently ranks fourth in program history in career goals (64) and tied for fourth in assists (36). With 10 goals and eight assists so far this fall, she’s on her way to finishing second in both categories. 
“I don’t really think it matters too much,” she said of the numbers. “If what the team needs me to do is score goals, that’s what I want to do for my teammates. But it’s not really about me. The last piece might be me scoring a goal, but it took a bunch of plays by my teammates to get the ball up there. To me, it’s more about the team.” 
That team is 10-0-2 so far and ranked No.1 in Division III. Elsaesser, who graduates in May with a degree in athletic training, would love to bookend her career by leading Messiah to another national title. No matter what happens, though, the experience has been the ultimate victory. 
“My coach always talks about excellence, which is doing the little things right every day,” she said. “That’s how you become better. I’m going to take that with me in whatever I do after graduation.” 
College Corner appears each Tuesday in the Courier News and Home News Tribune. Send tips to Jerry Carino: jcarino@gannettnj.com . Read or Share this story: http://mycj.co/1RDlWdO TOP VIDEOS
